Author: neonesk#9055
Content: Good day. I just sent BTC from the AtomicDEX Android app to a segwit address starting with 3. Or I tried, because after sending I saw that the app did not send to my address, but it sent to a legacy address that I don't know and that never received funds before. How come the Android AtomicDEX sends to an unknown legacy BTC address when sending to a BTC segwit address?

Author: Acura#2748
Content: Segwit actually not supported in AtomicDex

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: @TonyL @smk762 can anybody help me with above? @gcharang is offline

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Have you already tried to restart the phone?

Author: neonesk#9055
Content:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Use AtomicDEX on Android, version 0.1.4-6d
2. Tap Bitcoin
3. Tap Send
4. Fill in amount & segwit adres
5. Tap "Withdraw"
6. See segwit address show up in confirmation screen
https://i.imgur.com/t0NSmKV.jpg
7. Tap "Confirm"
8. See BTC sent to a legacy address instead of the address in confirmation screen

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `1. Use AtomicDEX on Android, version 0.1.4-6d` is `very` old version, please update

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: actual version is 0.2.8, you're using version almost half of year old. New mm2 and GUI not allow to send btc to segwit addresses

Author: neonesk#9055
Content: That sounds good. Didn't know I was on an old version like that ðŸ˜®

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: 0.1.4 was released on Jul 24 ðŸ˜…

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: legacy already hehe

Author: CoinKing88#1540
Content: @TonyL ill try that first

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: If it'll not help please DM me the app log (settings -> send log)

Author: neonesk#9055
Content: @TonyL Thanks for your replies! The Play Store said I installed the latest version. Though the app still said 0.1.4-6d. Had to uninstall app & re-install again to see the latest Android app version, 0.2.8. When I try to send to a segwit address is now shows "Error, please try later". That's good & safe.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Always glad to help! From my experience Play Store got some problems with caching (sometimes Play Store cache clearing helps to see the new version)

Author: artemciy_dice#0049
Content:
To recap, we can't disable the sounds for now, but we're making them configurable. The option to pick a local sound file is in the works.

Now, I wonder if someone else likes to create sounds, with https://tonematrix.audiotool.com/ ( https://youtu.be/TaeeiLzfVmc ) and the like? I wonder what the consensus would be on adding support for such custom sounds into the AtomicDEX sound configuration.
